tags: part of the journey is the end
summary:
Marvel: we're releasing all the trailers very soon!
Me: *sighs* finally, about time.
*day it's released*
Friend: ready to watch...
body:
Marvel: we’re releasing all the trailers very soon!

Me: *sighs* finally, about time.

*day it’s released*

Friend: ready to watch it?!

Me: *holding a box of tissues already crying, not ready to have my heart broken* y'know, I might actually watch it later instead.

summary: “Note: This page was cut for reason: Movie isn’t out yet and the page is attracting as much controversy and stupidity as the...
body:
“Note: This page was cut for reason: Movie isn’t out yet and the page is attracting as much controversy and stupidity as the film itself. Leave off until the damn thing is released”

I’d really like to know what sort of things people were writing into this page to have the whole thing cut. Like, usually when angry people are posting tons of hate and stupidity into a TV Tropes page, the page gets locked from editing for a while until things calm down. How bad must things have gotten for them to just flippantly declare “Know what-NOT WORTH IT! Delete the stupid thing and we’ll put it back up when we absolutely have to!”

Like, for crying out loud. I haven’t been looking in comments sections or looking up what people are saying about Captain Marvel, because I just know there’s going to be stupid discourse, but has the discourse really been THAT bad?

summary: Not gonna lie—I’m pretty psyched for CAPTAIN MARVEL after that new trailer, you guys. Here’s the one cover I did featuring Ms....
body: Not gonna lie—I’m pretty psyched for CAPTAIN MARVEL after that new trailer, you guys. Here’s the one cover I did featuring Ms. Danvers (alongside the original Captain Marvel) for a special called Generations, where the two team up for the first time. *Might* have some new Captain Marvel art to share soon, stay tuned… 😉

reblog.comment: Not gonna lie—I’m pretty psyched for CAPTAIN MARVEL after that new trailer, you guys. Here’s the one cover I did featuring Ms. Danvers (alongside the original Captain Marvel) for a special called Generations, where the two team up for the first time. *Might* have some new Captain Marvel art to share soon, stay tuned… 😉

summary: Captain Marvel’s helmet/mohawk movie costume is the result of a bet - Polygon “And so I called Jamie and was like, ‘Alright, I...
caption:
Captain Marvel’s helmet/mohawk movie costume is the result of a bet - Polygon

“And so I called Jamie and was like, ‘Alright, I want you to make a bet with me. I bet if you do a Carol Danvers redesign for Captain Marvel that Marvel will buy the design from you. And if I win this bet, then I get a redesign and you get paid. And if I lose this bet, I will pay for the redesign.’”

DeConnick said she still has no idea whether McKelvie would have actually taken her up on that money, but her plan was to pay for it out of pocket if necessary. She admits that the whole thing didn’t make a lot of sense.

This is a great behind-the-scenes story. Also, Jamie McKelvie draws the best lewks in modern comics, hands down, and I’m very glad Kelly Sue DeConnick made this happen back in the day.

summary:
I wasn't so excited for Captain Marvel after the first trailer, but I am way more intrigued after the second one.
However,...
body:
I wasn’t so excited for Captain Marvel after the first trailer, but I am way more intrigued after the second one.

However, because she is the most powerful character the MCU has done so far, I’m really afraid she’ll end up being the equivilent of how I see Superman, overpowered and underwhelming in terms of personality.

I want her to be amazing. I don’t want her to be just a walking powerhouse.
